WorkPlace.Name: Taconic Biosciences A/S - Lille Skensved, Sjælland
WorkPlace.Description:
Taconic Biosciences er Skandinaviens største avlscenter for dyr til biomedicinsk forskning. Vore produkter spiller en vigtig rolle i udviklingen af bedre og sikrere lægemidler til mennesker over hele verden. Taconic Biosciences er en del af en familieejet amerikansk koncern.

Yderligere oplysninger om Taconic se  www.taconic.com
WorkPlace.OrganizationDescription: Taconic is a privately held (family owned) company, with 830 employees, and $130M and with HQ in New York. As the premier brand in the invivo GEM industry, Taconic is the world leader in embryonic stem cell design and genetically engineered (rodent) research models and services for pre-clinical drug discovery & translational science. Customers include most of top 50 pharma & biotechs and universities worldwide.

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Field Application Scientist (m/f/d) at Taconic Bioscienses A/S

Are you motivated by new opportunities and seek a stimulating working environment within the biotech industry?

We invite you to join our international team of talented employees as our new Field Application Scientist working remotely in Denmark, Germany, France or the Netherlands.

We are looking for a dedicated and motivated person who can help us carry out our mission: To create innovative solutions that both progress medical research and maintain the highest standards of laboratory animal care. 

As a Field Applications Scientist, you will work closely with product management and account managers to support Taconic customers before, during, and after a sale.

The ideal candidate will have an advanced scientific background, and in vivo rodent model experience with emphasis in immunology, oncology, immuno-oncology, neurodegenerative disease, metabolic disease, or related fields. 

This is a highly collaborative, team-based position and since this role interacts frequently with multiple internal and external stakeholders, highly developed communication and interpersonal skills are a must.

Essential job functions include the following:

  • Provide application support across multiple scientific disciplines as they pertain to in vivo rodent studies in drug discovery and development
  • Provide scientific education and training on Taconic products through various channels (e.g. workshops, seminars, webinars, teleconferences, scientific conferences, journal articles, etc.)
  • Develop customer relationships by providing technical consultations and support, establishing collaborations, and understanding customer needs and requirements
  • Troubleshoot scientific and application problems and make product recommendations
  • Work cross-functionally with internal stakeholders to develop and implement territory plans by providing scientific and market expertise
  • Contribute to the development of new products and applications
  • Develop new marketing content for key product applications
  • Assist in technical training for sales and support personnel
  • Contribute to other internal and external projects to support key business objectives
  • Other duties may be assigned.

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Has achieved their PhD (MD, DVM or other doctoral degrees considered) with 2-5 years of relevant in vivo research experience
  • Is fluent in English with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to communicate in German or French is desirable
  • Has the ability to effectively present information and address complex scientific questions through proven presentation and writing skills
  • Is a strong experimentalist with experience in designing and interpreting in vivo rodent research studies, preferably as these pertain to preclinical drug development
  • Has knowledge of diverse animal models and disease pathologies; preferably with specialized expertise in one or more of the following fields: Immunology, oncology, immuno-oncology, neuroscience, metabolic disease
  • Builds long lasting relationships and understands the value of animal models in research
  • Is independent, self-driven, approachable and engaging
  • Is able to travel (up to 80%) mostly within Europe.

Working at Taconic:

You will work closely with product management and account managers to support Taconic customers before, during, and after a sale.

We offer you:

  • Intercultural working environment with room to bring in your own ideas
  • A full-time position
  • Flexible working time
  • Mobile work

Frequent travel is required in this role, generally multiple trips each month and primary job responsibilities include traveling.

About Us

With a history of over 65 years of excellence, Taconic Biosciences is a global team of the best problem solvers in the industry.  We partner with our clients to develop winning research strategies that accelerate the discoveries for prevention and treatment of disease.

Taconic employees all over the world show up every day to deliver the best solutions for our clients while caring for ourselves, each other, and especially our animals.  If you are a respectful, compassionate individual with a can-do attitude and a desire to do the right thing, we want you to join us! 

Better Together at Taconic

Inclusion, Diversity, Awareness & Action.Taconic Biosciences is taking an active and intentional role in creating a company culture that encourages and appreciates the uniqueness in all people. Being you is what allows you to bring your best self to work. We are committed to ensuring that Taconic is a safe and fair workplace for everyone because it’s our differences that make us stronger. We are better together.

Application:

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your application (CV, motivation letter, references, salary expectation and notice period) through our E-Recruiting portal Jazz HR by clicking here

                                            
Contact details:  If you have questions about employment in Taconic Bioscience, please contact HR Partner Christina Jensen at christina.jensen@taconic.com.
